applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the provided Pension Life Cover Scheme Rules document for several key reasons: 1) The regulation specifically addresses cooling-off periods for services provided through digital platforms, while this document is a comprehensive scheme rules document that outlines the operation of a pension life cover scheme. 2) While the document mentions AIB life and includes contact information, it does not discuss or establish any cooling-off or withdrawal periods that would trigger this regulatory requirement. 3) The document is primarily focused on defining the rules, benefits, and trustee responsibilities for an occupational pension scheme rather than describing consumer rights related to digital platform services. 4) The document appears to be governed primarily by the Pensions Act and Tax Consolidation Act rather than consumer protection regulations related to digital services. The nature of the product (an employer-established pension scheme) is fundamentally different from the type of consumer financial services contemplated by the cooling-off period regulation.
regulation_title: Notice of upcoming expiry of cooling off period to be given
regulation_text: 43. A regulated entity that has provided a financial service to a consumer by means of a digital platform, to which a right of withdrawal (a "cooling off") period applies, shall contact a consumer at least 3 working days, but no more than 7 working days, prior to the expiry of the withdrawal period, to remind the consumer of the consumer's right of withdrawal, the date on which this right expires, and how the consumer can exercise this right. Chapter 5 Informing effectively
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
